bioghist.p: David Hudson (1917-2003) was Poet Laureate of Delaware from 1956 to 1960 and from 1975 to 1978. He began writing poetry in the 1930s and found a forum for presenting it through the Wilmington Music and Poetry Society. In the late 1940s, Hudson produced a weekly half hour program of local poetry on radio station WILM. Hudson published a number of poetry books with works by himself and others under the imprint of the Wilmington Poetry Society and Delaware Writers, Inc. A native of Wilmington, Hudson was a passionate advocate for the city, an was active in neighborhood preservation and beautification projects. He was a leader in the Baynard Boulevard Neighborhood Association in the city's old Ninth Ward. Hudson was vocal about expressing his opinions before Wilmington City Council, doing so with such regularity that he was named the "honorary 14th member" by the group.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of the poet David Hudson. Materials include: correspondence, postcards, photographs, photocopies of articles and manuscripts, typescripts, artwork, certificates, notes, and volumes of poetry written by David Hudson, as well as printed programs and booklets which include his poetry along with the work of other Delaware poets. The collection also includes papers related to Hudson's involvement in local civic and cultural activities such as the Baynard Boulevard Neighborhood Association, the Wilmington City Council, the Delaware Poetry Center, the Wilmington Poetry Society, and Delaware Writers Inc.
